wikipedia_page.main:
Albert Edward Mallalieu (13 January 1904 – March 1991) was an English cricketer. Mallalieu was a right-handed batsman.  He was born in Delph, Saddleworth, Yorkshire.
Malalieu his first-class debut for Wales against Scotland in 1924.  He made five further first-class appearances for Wales, the last of which came against the Marylebone Cricket Club in 1930.  In his six first-class appearances, he scored 137 runs at an average of 17.12, with a high score of 66.  His score, his only first-class fifty, came against Ireland in 1925.He died in March 1991 in Huddersfield, Yorkshire.
